page.title: 10THE HEYFORD HORNETS
page.content: The Athletics Club is called the Heyford Hornets A. A. Club. The club has its own shirts and shorts with the name on them. Every Wednesday night the children and the adults meet at the Green to train. The children pay 15p per week to the club. They start at 6.30 and finish at 8.30. At the moment the club hasn't got any equipment but they do sponsored runs and fundraising. Usually the adults put the children into these races. On Sundays the children usually run to Bugbrooke and back, a total of 3 miles. The Hornets had a float in the mini-carnival that started the {Village Hall Silver Jubilee Fete} on Sat 29th June. On Sun 30th June there was the annual Round the Village Road Race and many of the Hornets entered. I won the Junior Girls' Race for the third year in succession.
